title: "adc is dead now that varus and jhin got nerfed" ....
body:
Varus and Jhin were the reason why every other adc was dead... 

you couldn't compete to a Varus or Jhin lane, especially Varus was such a pain in the ass to lane against that every adc that needed to scale before being usefull was dead

Yeah honestly I think crit Varus might be super viable now. Between the buff to his passive earlier in the season and the fact that building lethality on ADCs is no longer as attractive, I could see crit AD casters (i.e. Ashe, Lucian, crit Varus, crit MF, etc.) coming on pretty strong. In theory their ability damage should help them not be super terrible early-mid game and then late game they will have all the power of a normal crit adc.

It's not a minor change though, it's a pretty hefty nerf on the cooldown of it.

Thing is Jhin still needs to auto for the MAJORITY of his damage (especially late game). DFT made his damage on his long range abilities (ult and w) hit quite a bit harder. Hitting the CC on his ult was a good change in theory because his ult damage wasn't really the busted part. 

Varus on the other hand got the majority of his damage from his super long range Q which he just spammed late game. Chunking the back line for half their health. Whereas Jhins shit can be blocked by tanks (also doesn't scale as well or have as high damg as Varus Q)

If you asked any high elo player they'd say Jhin makes ADC viable whereas Varus is busted as shit. Also the reason why Varus is almost a MUST BAN red side in competitive whereas letting Jhin through is a common occurrence
This is pretty much how I feel about the subject.

The executing crit bullshit is the reason Jhin is so overbearing imo. He can hold onto a shot that's guaranteed to do at least 100-150 damage at level 1 for 10 seconds. I cant tell you how many times I have played support against a Jhin only for him to walk up and chunk either me or my ADC and then run away with his superspeed with only 1/4 of the damage in retaliation. Make his regular autos non-executing, and I would be fine with it.

Ok... Let's have a little discussion shall we?

What has been nerfed?

DFT was nerfed in this patch by quite a bit, this affects a bit MF and Varus and really hurts Jhin's lategame if he goes for lethality because of how his passive works

MF was nerfed, they reduced her Q damage and they removed her bonus damage on it

Varus was nerfed, they nerfed his Q damage and CD

If i'm not mistaken these are the nerf to lethality ADC... But what actually got buffed? 

Crit ADCs all across the board... Even crit MF and crit Varus... Why? 

With the MF lethality nerfs they actually buffed crit MF because they changed her Q to make it crit if the first hit kills the target and that it actually can crit with crit chance, the best is to build hybrid lethality and crit like Jhin (also Black cleaver is not so viable anymore on MF ADC but can be good on MF supp)

Varus had his Q changed to reduce its cooldown if it blows a stack of his W, so now he has to AA in order to use his kit properly

Then we have the new Warlord's, it's really good actually, it synergizes very well with RFC and Statik's and it's really good for kiting and heals for a lot

The new Bork can actually be really good on crit ADCs over BT, because with Warlord's that heals you for even 50% every 3/4 autos in lategame the 20% lifesteal from BT can be overkill, the 15% from Bork is enough imo but it's situational, the new Bork is also better early game but it scales in the late very well and this helps Kalista and Bork/Triforce builds

Lucian got also buffed, it's more a qol change but I think it will bring him up a bit

And let's not forget that Fervor got buffed a few weeks ago, that helps Lucian, Ezreal and possibly Corki (but not that much because of his nerfs)
